document_data.name: Illuskan
document_data.mainbody: '''Illuskan''' was an ethnic [[human]] language spoken in northwest [[Faerûn]], largely by [[Illuskan]]s.<ref name=FRCS-p85>{{cite book/FRCS|85}}
document_data.Speakers: Illuskan was commonly used as a ''lingua franca'' along the [[Sword Coast North]], in addition to the ubiquitous [[Common]]. Other regions where it was commonly spoken included [[Mintarn]], the [[Moonshaes]], [[Ruathym]], and among the [[Uthgardt]].<ref name=FRCS-p85/>
document_data.Dialects: There were three major dialects of Illuskan. Moonshae was spoken by the [[Ffolk]] and the [[Northlander]]s of the [[Moonshae Isles]]. Ruathen was spoken in [[Ruathym]], and True Luskan was the dialect of the city-state of [[Luskan]].<ref name=D:SiT-p28>{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|28}} [[Bothii]], the language of the Uthgardt, was treated by some as a dialect of Illuskan.<ref name=FRCS-p168>
document_data.Script: Like the majority of Faerûn's human tongues, Illuskan used the [[Thorass alphabet]].<ref name=FRCS-p85/>
document_data.History: Illuskan was in the [[Illuski languages|Illuski language group]], the same family language as Bothii and [[Reghedjic language|Reghedjic]].<ref name=D:SiT-p28/> It derived from [[Old Illuskan]] and was strongly influenced by [[Netherese language|Netherese]].<ref name=RoF-p94>
document_data.Examples:
Common Illuskan surnames included Brightwood, Helder, Hornraven, Lackman, Stonar, Stormwind, and Winddrivver. Common male names included Ander, Blath, Bran, Frath, Geth, Lander, Luth, Malcer, Stor, Taman, and Urth. Common female names were Amafrey, Betha, Cefrey, Kethra, Mara, Olga, Silifrey, and Westra.<ref name=FRCS-p12>

The city of [[Neverwinter]] was originally called "Eigersstor", the Illuskan translation of the name.

Dictionary.Hamfriggan: Lit. shapestrong, used to refer to the shapeshifters of Ruathym
